result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kalle Kion Skalsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 14, 2016.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Undergo a Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Amy Skalsky.
-Undergo a Domestic Abuse Evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.
-Apology Letter to Amy Skalsky by May 1, 2016.
-Defendant to participate in Restorative Justice Program

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb,  ADA:  Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Kalle Kion Skalsky appeared.  Court called at 9:20 a.m. Set for FPT.  Attorney Hartung recites the agreement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  State moves to amend Ct. 2 to State Disorderly Conduct with the second paragraph and the domestic abuse enhancer stricken.  DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct 2.   Crt reviews the police reports.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudciated guilty of the amended Ct 2.  Ct. 1 the DE will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for 30 months.    Sentencing arguments. Victim makes statement.  Crt orders:

Amended Ct. 1
- S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- DE is ordered that he have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons, A. Skalsky.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- DE to undergo a domestic abuse evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment or therapy
- DE to undergo a psychological evaluation and follow throgh with any recommended treatment or therapy
- Apology letter to A. skalsky by 05/01/16
- DE to participate in a restorative justice panel
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid through the DOC
- Restitution in the amount of $30.00
- Sign up for probation today 01/14/16
- 20 days to appeal

Ct. 1 the DE will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for 30 months.  
-Court reviews the agreement.  
- Court approves the agreement and signs the Order.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement. UNSIGNED by EJL. km
Final pre-trial at 01-14-2016 09:15 am

*AMENDED*

 It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Amy S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Liddle ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Daniel Frank Demaio   DF:  Kalle Kion Skalsky appeared. Case called at 9:17 a.m. Court notes this was the date and time for a jury trial. There is an agreement so will be a plea hearing today. ADA Hartung recites agreement and recommendations. DE is active in the military. Victims rights have been complied with and victim is present in the courtroom. Victim would like to make a statement. Atty Demaio  moves to amend the bond to no abusive contact with Ms. Skalsky. Atty Demaio gives sentencing arguments. Court reads charges, rights and maximum penalties. SIDEBAR. Court will take a short recess at 9:29 a.m. Case recalled at 9:36 a.m. Atty Demaio makes statement. Would like to reset this hearing. ADA Hartung requesting to be set for a final pre trial. Address confirmed. Bail to be continued. Court will modify bond to no abusive contact.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Plea hearing at 01-07-2016 09:00 am
filed by Atty Daniel DeMaio. eif

Status conference on March 16, 2015 at 11:15 am.

***AMENDED June 10, 2015***
No Contact modified to EMAIL for children's purposes only.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Amy S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
